author: 3xmd1559sporebraytondingo
content: How often would zero-gas tx occur pre-1559? [context: https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-4803]

author: 3xmd1559sporebraytondingo
content: Would Flashbots bundles generally pay out-of-band, for instance?

author: timbeiko
content: <@!339771292884664320> yes, and miner payouts would pay 0 gas too

author: timbeiko
content: I'm not sure if a 0 gas txn would actually get propagated on the p2p network, but if you could send it to a miner and one way or another get them to include it, it would be valid.

author: djrtwo
content: I think going with contract massively reduces complexity, regardless of how the CL ETH is transported back into EL

author: sky.cactus
content: Fight in #party-lounge

author: djrtwo
content:
my pref is irregular state change at shanghai that deploys the bytecode and drops in  `2^42069` into the contract
my second pref is irregular state change at shanghai that deploys the bytecode and adds an exceptional rule for sending regardless of blaance of that contract

author: timbeiko
content: I can't really join the breakout room today, but I would go towards your second pref.

author: axic3354
content: Re withdrawals. I would like to also rectify the total supply problem. Potentially at the beginning of a block both the withdrawal and deposit contracts balances could be synchronised according to the beacon state.

author: m.kalinin
content: very interesting discussion, i hope we will get back to it sometime soon. but gotta drop off üëã

author: timbeiko
content: Does that imply that withdrawals need to be done at the start of the block?

author: axic3354
content: No

author: timbeiko
content: Ah, so during a block‚Äôs execution, you end up with different balances, but it resets each block?

author: axic3354
content: yes

author: axic3354
content: i dont think it is cosmetic, but rather removing the need for precompiles and or special transfer rules

author: axic3354
content: initially i was like "lets replace the deposit contract code" to have withdrawals, but i think setting at the block is nicer / less riskier

author: timbeiko
content: Is there a way to do this with "perfect" accounting, e.g. at a transaction level rather than block? I feel we should at least consider the option before we dismiss it as being too complex.

author: axic3354
content: basically balances over execution+consensus are 100% correct at the beginning of the block, so if anyone needs that figure they need to check it at the beginning

author: axic3354
content: not sure the complexity to do it at tx level is worth it

author: sky.cactus
content: I think it will be correct for the entire block.

author: axic3354
content: i think so too, but havent verified my assumption

author: peter.davies
content: People can use `SELFDESTRUCT` to send eth to the withdrawal contract.

author: timbeiko
content: AH! I just realized I had misunderstood your proposal, Alex. You are saying that, at the start of the block you deduct from the deposit contract the sum of all the withdrawal receipts which will be processed in this block?

author: sky.cactus
content: You just set the deposit contract to 0.

author: sky.cactus
content: And you set the withdraw contract to the "balance of consensus layer ETH".

author: axic3354
content: ‚òùÔ∏è

author: timbeiko
content: Ahhh! That means that you are then bringing in the validator rewards in the EL, correct?

author: timbeiko
content: (accounting-wise)

author: axic3354
content: could also set deposit to `balance - pending_withdraw`, and withdrawal to `pending_withdraw`

author: timbeiko
content: I prefer this, but both options are much simpler/cleaner than what I had in mind üòÑ

author: axic3354
content: if we want to make it more complicated :)

author: timbeiko
content: This might also make it easier to test for edge cases, right, because we'd expect the withdrawal contract to end the block at >0, but close, rather than `balance-pending_withdraw`
